titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Aaron Konkle Hughes Navy papers and John A. H. Nickels journal, 1839-1884

publicationstmt.publisher: The New York Public Library. Manuscripts and Archives Division.

address.addressline: Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street, New York, NY 10018-2788

profiledesc.creation: EAD generated by archives.nypl.org on December 9, 2014

did.unittitle: Aaron Konkle Hughes Navy papers and John A. H. Nickels journal

repository.corpname: The New York Public Library. Manuscripts and Archives Division.

address.addressline: Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street, New York, NY 10018-2788

did.abstract: This collection is comprised of 6 volumes: midshipman's logs of the U. S. frigate Constitution, March 13 1839 through September 16, 1840, and of the U. S. brigantine Boxer, April 21, 1842 through October 6, 1843; letter books while in command respectively of the U.S.S. Pensacola, the naval station at Port Royal, South Carolina, and the navy yard at Norfolk, Virginia, July 31, 1874 through August 5, 1879; letter book as Rear Admiral in command of the Pacific station, January 1, 1883 through March 31, 1884; and journal of the commander in chief of the Pacific squadron, as kept by Lieutenant John A. K. Nickels

prefercite.p: Aaron Konkle Hughes Navy papers and John A. H. Nickels journal, Manuscripts and Archives Division, The New York Public Library
